Class WelcomeController

java.lang.Object
com.example.miniproyecto3.controller.WelcomeController
public class WelcomeController extends Object
Controller class for handling the Welcome Stage of the application. Manages player input, initialization of music, game state continuity, and UI interactions. It also supports file checking and visual feedback before entering the game.
Since:
version 2.0
Version:
3.0
Author:
David Taborda Montenegro and Juan Pablo Piedrahita Triana.

  • Field Details

    • onContinue

      public boolean onContinue
      Boolean flag to know if the player wants to continue a game.

  • Constructor Details

    • WelcomeController

      public WelcomeController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the welcome screen by playing background music and ensuring the existence of the player data file. If the file does not exist, it creates one with default values.

    • onHandlePlayButton

      public void onHandlePlayButton() throws VisualException, IOException
      Handles the event triggered when the user clicks the "Play" button. Loads player data from the plane text file or creates a new one if the username is new, and initializes the game stage.
      Throws:
      VisualException - if there is an error while loading the visual stage.
      IOException - if an I/O operation fails.
      See Also:
      • VisualException

    • onHandleContinueButton

      public void onHandleContinueButton()
      Handles the event triggered when the user clicks the "Continue" button. Loads previous player data and restores the game state if a save file exists. If no file exists, a warning alert is shown to the user.

    • onHandleQuitButton

      public void onHandleQuitButton()
      Handles the event triggered when the user clicks the "Quit" button. Closes the current welcome stage instance.

    • getContinue

      public boolean getContinue()
      Returns whether the player chose to continue a previous game or not.
      Returns:
      true if continuing a saved game, false otherwise.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Returns the player currently interacting with the welcome screen.
      Returns:
      the current Player instance.

    • onHandleCreditsButton

      public void onHandleCreditsButton()
      Handles the event triggered when the user clicks the "Credits" button. Displays a styled dialog with information about the game's title, authorship, and a thank-you message for the player.
